article:
The Lions Club supports an Eye Bank inWashington and Idaho. The Eye Bank   _   over 400cornea transplants   each year. Frequentlydonated   corneas from dead persons must bespecially packed and a volunteer is   _   to pick up thepackage and take it to the hospital as   _   as possible.One night, the program coordinator was in great   _  .She had a package on a bus to a   _   place andno one was willing to pick it up. She called the list ofemergency volunteers,and all   _   to do it,as it was after   _  .
Then she called a very   _   man. The upset mantold her that he had volunteered to be on the contactlist,   _   had made it clear that he was only free inthe afternoons and evenings before 8 p.m, and ingood   _   only. "It's 1 a.m. and it's snowing here, "he   _  . At last, the coordinator persuaded him, but he said, "I'll do it just this time; please don't   _   call me again. "Then he got up, and as he was getting   _  , his little son came out and asked to go along.
They drove in   _    through the snow for along time to the bus station, picked up the package,and drove   _   the hospital. On the trip back   _  , the son asked what the package had been.Dad  explained that it was tissue(, )from the eyes of someone who had   _  . It wasgoing to help someone else   _   again. The boythought it over for a moment and said,"Dad, I neverknew you did such   _   things!"The next day, theman called the coordinator back. "You can call me   _   you need to," he said.
